body:
I agree it is long but I don't see a problem here, I'm happy to provide shorter name if they are expressive enough.
Having said that `shouldHaveThrown()` looks fine, so it will be added.

Anyway with Java 8 support coming, this will not be necessary to assert exception as one will be able to write:

``` java
Jedi yoda = new Jedi("Yoda", "Green");
assertThatExceptionThrownBy(() -> { throw new Exception(yoda + " is no Sith"); })
                           .isInstanceOf(Exception.class)
                           .hasMessage(yoda + " is no Sith");
```

Uhm, OK, let us forget about Java 8 for a moment ;) But anyway, I'd have written your code above as:

``` java
assertThat(/* something */).throwsInstanceOf(...).withMessage(...)
```

However, I am curious as to how you want to do that; I guess this would be a `Collector`? You cannot throw from lambdas normally, so you have to wrap the throwing code into some interface, right?

If you already have an idea as to how to do that I'd be interested to see what you came up with...

In the meantime, as a convinced Java 8 user but who has to work with "lesser" versions, I'd be very hapy indeed with `shoudHaveThrown()` in the meantime ;)

Have a look at https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/blob/master/src/test/java/org/assertj/core/api/throwable/ThrowableAssert_built_from_Callable_Test.java

It will be available in the version 2.0 based on java 7 (assertj-core for Java 8 will hav its own release cycle ).

Marked failBecauseExceptionWasNotThrown as deprecated and created a similar one named shouldHaveThrown(). Also switched all tests the new one. 
Do we need the deprecated one or can we get rid off it?
Don't deprecate it please, let users pick what they prefer, just add in `failBecauseExceptionWasNotThrown` javadoc that `shouldHaveThrown` can be used as a replacement.

Hi, is version 1.7 no longer maintained? I like this nicer method but it is only now available for version 2 and 3. I work with Android libraries so I can't use the newer versions.

Thanks!
It's not maintained actively but I accept any PR and will release new 1.x versions when needed, so to be clear if you want something to included in 1.x, create a PR.

issue.title: Primitive Value Approximation Assertion

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

body: I see, unfortunately I don't have much free time, But I'll see if I can get around to it. Thanks!
reopened waiting for a PR to get it merged in 1.x branch
should not be needed if we introduce Java6Assertions in 2.x branch (#500)
Should be addressed by #521 by using `Java6Assertions`.
